sponsor: National Institute of General Medical Sciences (NIGMS)
briefTitle: Randomized Trial of Inhaled Nitric Oxide to Augment Tissue Perfusion in Sepsis
officialTitle: Randomized Double-blind Placebo-controlled Trial of Inhaled Nitric Oxide for the Treatment of Microcirculatory Dysfunction and Organ Failure in Sepsis
summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether inhaled nitric oxide is an effective treatment for microcirculatory dysfunction and acute organ system failure in the early stage of sepsis therapy.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change in the Sequential Organ Failure Assessment (SOFA) Score
